channel.title: jSpiderRun - Lastest Git Push: March 24, 2012
channel.description:
[ul][b]What is jSpiderRun:[/b] way back when in the early 90's I would go to my grandfathers house and play a game called SpiderRun on his 486 along with other classics such as Jill of the Jungle and Wolf3D. I was recently talking to my cousin about the game and decided I wanted to take a shot in recreating it.
Image of original Game:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/7P2N0.png[/img]
for those of you that don't want to run dosBox or an actual dox Machine you can play the original game here: http://www.classicdosgames.com/online/spider21.html
The Github:https://github.com/silabsoft/jSpiderRun
Progress:
[list] [li]Stripped the basics from Dragnor to create this since I am really lazy.[/li] [li]have the basic tile web created and have a sample tile for rotation testing[/li] [li]Some more changes to the code I still have yet to actually create the tiles because I'm lazy and easily get frustrated with GIMP main changes was for the rotation I wanted both left and right rotation of tiles with the mouse not really sure if the method I use is acceptable if anyone has an alternative please let me know[/li] [li] after screwing around with the tiles I finally got the basic tiles setup, now starting to work on the spider. I hate GIMP [/li]
[li][b]March/02/2012:[/b] The generated web is now not completely random each level can be set with different rules for the web generation [/li] [li] [b]March/10/2012:[/b] Added basic pathing for the spider as well as elbow rotation Also due to BBcode being rather queer I will just post the pictures of progress at the bottom in a different list.[/li] [li] [b]March/18/2012:[/b] full web warping intact now all thats left is to tackle scoring, a level system, highscores, warp tile reset, add a few additional tiles, sound, and removing the shit coding.[/li] [li] [b]March/24/2012: [/b] Lots of small changes throughout the source, you will notice that you have to press a new game to start there is about a 5 second delay between the time you press new game and when the spider starts his travel, I do plan to implement sounds so you can hear the countdown. Also added was the scoring interface although no scoring actually takes place yet.[/li] [li] [b]March/28/2012: [/b] Simple scoring interface has been added everything needs a good cleanup but the first level is completely playable if anyone wants to beta test [/li] [li] [b]April/01/2012: [/b] Started work on the highscores, the pit tile is added, warp gauge is started [/li] [li] [b]April/08/2012: [/b] Been a week since I added any progress to the git, warpguage is semi working. [/li] [/list]
Screenshot progress: [list] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/kbdE0.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/DuK6V.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/R5gNH.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Go7kv.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/1y854.png[/img][/li] [li][img]http://i.imgur.com/FoIsF.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/OLI2l.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ISW9E.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/KyXKW.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/U1VFL.png[/img][/li] [li][IMG]http://i.imgur.com/MJgs6.png[/img][/li] [/list]
Please feel free to criticize this "pile of silab" on [b] ANYTHING EXCEPT THE MEDIA(graphics/sounds) BECAUSE ITS NOT MY FORTE[/b]
If you feel like donating artwork for the project please feel free.
inb4 good practice of loading resources - it's temporary.[/ul]

item.title: jSpiderRun - Lastest Git Push: March 24, 2012
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:4, topic:433348”]The top screenshot looks so much more polished then the previous ones.

Looks awesome![/quote]
fku

Lin:

This looks like the same puzzle idea that was in Mickey’s Racing Adventure, where the train was following tracks laid out on tiles and you have to move the tiles around to get to a destination. If it is (although it looks like you might just end up rotating or switching the tiles, not sure), then this is awesome. Good luck!

yes in this game you just rotate the tiles and the spider moves along the path, some levels have an END tile which requires to the spider to die in to progress to the next level. I don’t know if the original game had anything more complex than this as I only ever had the shareware version which included 10 levels. However I do have some plans to extend on the game play once I finish getting it all thrown together

Read full topic

item.title: jSpiderRun - Lastest Git Push: March 24, 2012
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[ul]What is jSpiderRun: way back when in the early 90’s I would go to my grandfathers house and play a game called SpiderRun on his 486 along with other classics such as Jill of the Jungle and Wolf3D. I was recently talking to my cousin about the game and decided I wanted to take a shot in recreating it.

Image of original Game:

for those of you that don’t want to run dosBox or an actual dox Machine you can play the original game here: http://www.classicdosgames.com/online/spider21.html

The Github:https://github.com/silabsoft/jSpiderRun

Progress:

[list]
[li]Stripped the basics from Dragnor to create this since I am really lazy.[/li]
[li]have the basic tile web created and have a sample tile for rotation testing[/li]
[li]Some more changes to the code I still have yet to actually create the tiles because I’m lazy and easily get frustrated with GIMP main changes was for the rotation I wanted both left and right rotation of tiles with the mouse not really sure if the method I use is acceptable if anyone has an alternative please let me know[/li]
[li]
after screwing around with the tiles I finally got the basic tiles setup, now starting to work on the spider. I hate GIMP
[/li]

[li]March/02/2012:
The generated web is now not completely random each level can be set with different rules for the web generation
[/li]
[li] March/10/2012: Added basic pathing for the spider as well as elbow rotation Also due to BBcode being rather queer I will just post the pictures of progress at the bottom in a different list.[/li]
[li] March/18/2012: full web warping intact now all thats left is to tackle scoring, a level system, highscores, warp tile reset, add a few additional tiles, sound, and removing the shit coding.[/li]
[li] March/24/2012: Lots of small changes throughout the source, you will notice that you have to press a new game to start there is about a 5 second delay between the time you press new game and when the spider starts his travel, I do plan to implement sounds so you can hear the countdown. Also added was the scoring interface although no scoring actually takes place yet.[/li]
[li] March/28/2012: Simple scoring interface has been added everything needs a good cleanup but the first level is completely playable if anyone wants to beta test [/li]
[li] April/01/2012: Started work on the highscores, the pit tile is added, warp gauge is started [/li]
[li] April/08/2012: Been a week since I added any progress to the git, warpguage is semi working. [/li]
[/list]

Screenshot progress:

[li]

If you feel like donating artwork for the project please feel free.

inb4 good practice of loading resources - it’s temporary.[/ul]
